qas.question: In the U.S what does "Cultural Studies" focus largely on in this field?
Who first coined the term "Cultural Studies" in the United States?
What was the name of the company founded by Hoggart in 1964?

answers.text: Birmingham Centre for Contemporary Cultural Studies or CCCS

qas.question: The CCCS has since been associated with who?
In the UK what does "Cultural Studies" focus little on in this field?
Who first coined the term "Cultural Studies" in the United Kingdom?

plausible_answers.text: Birmingham Centre for Contemporary Cultural Studies

qas.question: What was the name of the company founded by Hoggart in 1954?
The CCCS has since been disassociated with who?

context: In the United States, "Cultural Studies" focuses largely on the study of <a0_0><b4_0>popular culture<b4_0/><a0_0/>, that is, on the social meanings of mass-produced consumer and leisure goods. <a1_0><b5_0>Richard Hoggart<b5_0/><a1_0/> coined the term in 1964 when he founded the <a2_0><b6_0>Birmingham Centre for Contemporary Cultural Studies<b6_0/> or CCCS<a2_0/>. It has since become strongly associated with <a3_0><b7_0>Stuart Hall<b7_0/><a3_0/>, who succeeded Hoggart as Director. Cultural studies in this sense, then, can be viewed as a limited concentration scoped on the intricacies of consumerism, which belongs to a wider culture sometimes referred to as "Western Civilization" or as "Globalism."
